tr.td:
ARAnyM 0.2.0 has been released and you can download it at usual place.
The major news in this release are EmuTOS being part of standard binary distribution, GUI runtime configuration (unfinished) and prepared floppy disk image with up-to-date ARAnyM drivers and utilities. Please read the complete NEWS file in the ARAnyM distribution.

ARAnyM 0.1.7 has been released and you can download it at usual place.
Highlights of this release are sound support (thanks to Didier of Aniplayer fame) and greatly debugged AranymFS.
The PurePascal screenshots added.
ARAnyM v0.1.6 has been released and you can download it at usual place. This time it was a simple but important fix that will help EmuTOS users.
ARAnyM v0.1.5 has been released and is available. The list of changes is too long to be put here so you may want to visit the CVS and read the NEWS file there.
Current ARAnyM (in CVS) runs FreeMiNT with Memory Protection.

ARAnyM v0.0.21 has just been released.
New version supports more architectures thanks to better IDE emulation.
And we have a new User Documentation.

Unsupported binary for MS Windows is available.
Also have a look at the new Emutos screenshots showing harddrive access.

ARAnyM v0.0.20 has just been released.
There were hundreds of changes and many improvements. Download the release and read the NEWS file.
FreeMiNT, fVDI, XaAES 0.934 screenshots added.
ARAnyM v0.0.11 has just been released.
I added first harddisk disk image to the Download area.
Download contains new source code snapshot with a ton of changes: fVDI is nearly perfect, Aranym TOS is no longer WinX patched, Floppy, EmuTOS and more things can be configured in the .aranymrc.
I managed to find TOS 4.04 on the web - see the Download section
The ST-Guide and Blyp screenshots added.

Download contains first source code snapshot.
ARAnyM now boots with original TOS 4.04 as well as with our 68040 aware ABTOS.
Screenshots added.

CVS opened for anonymous access.
Progress updated due to fVDI improvements.
Link to EmuTOS project added.
News page moved from Home to the News one.
Several design improvements.
preliminary version of the WWW pages online.
